solution_line_template: The total ratio for the cups of sugar and water needed to make lemonade is {sugar_ratio_part}+{water_ratio_part} = <<{sugar_ratio_part}+{water_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}
In the {total_ratio_parts} cups needed to make one liter of lemonade, the fraction representing the cups of sugar needed is {sugar_numerator}/{total_ratio_parts}.
If she used {total_cups_used} cups while making lemonade, she used {sugar_fraction}*{total_cups_used} = <<{total_cups_used}*{sugar_fraction}={sugar_cups_used}>>{sugar_cups_used} cups of sugar.
